parameters: Outside,\. there are slightly more enemies milling
about.\.\. I best be careful of the \C[2]Dark Knight\C[0]s\.
It is strongly recommended that as an RM developer,\.
you take a moment to look at the notes found in the
various enemies that roam the next map.
Not just in the events on the map, but in the database
as well.\. Due to the `J-LevelScaling` plugin,\. you
and enemies will deal increased/decreased damage
depending on level difference between us.
If we are to truly flex this JABS engine,\. we
should probably head to the dungeon down the stairs
to the right outside this weird spacey throne room.
Warnings should be taken seriously,\. though!

So you have no business with me.\. Understood.
Hello,\. my name is \C[6]Filthy Rich King\C[0].
I love giving away stuff to super poor and wimpy heroes
like yourself.\.\. Have one of everything.
\C[6]The old guy dressed in rags gave you a bunch of random crap.\C[0]
Do be aware that if you haven't gone through the tutorial yet,\.
it is highly recommended as some of these items and gear may
So you think you're above me?\. Fine then,\. be that way
Please be aware this system is not currently released
The crafting for those who like some degree of organization
JAFTING is a bit different than most crafting systems you
see out there- it takes place on the map!\. You'll notice that
all of us, including myself, will still be moving and whatnot
even while you're deep in the bowels of the various menus.
In JAFTING, there are three methods of creation:
- Crafting by Recipe (consume items to make new ones)
- Freestyle (consume item to generate random new ones from a list)
In v1.0, JAFTING will only include the \C[1]Creation by Recipe\C[0]
v2.0 is slated to include the \C[1]Refinement\C[0] method,
while v3.0 is slated to include the \C[2]Freestyle\C[0] method.
Enough about the history and shit, lets get JAFTING, shall we?
Though all inputs have been mapped to the keyboard,\.
it is \C[1]STRONGLY\C[0] recommended to use a controller that
This engine was tested using a \C[6]SteelSeries Stratus Duo\C[0].\.\.
Your button mapping mileage may vary depending on controller.
(the eternal struggle of using a controller on PC)
This is an \C[2]ABS\C[0],\. or \C[2]Action Battle System\C[0].\.\.
Certain popular franchises that start with \C[1]Zeld\C[0]-
have made such fast-paced gameplay like this very
Half the fun of these types of games are the hack n
Getting down to the basics,\. in order to attack,\.
you only need to press \C[1]A\C[0] on your gamepad,\.
or \C[2]Z\C[0] on the keyboard to swing the weapon
currently equipped in your main hand.
There are some boxes over to our right.\.
We can practice smacking them to get the hang of
Additionally,\. if you watch the gauge that appears
in the lower half of the screen (the action keys),\.
you can potentially chain together attacks as a combo
to deal tons of damage quickly.
Be aware that all skills-\. including basic attacks and
combos-\. have cooldowns.\.\. While on cooldown,\. that
particular action cannot be executed again.\.\.
For your convenience,\. the cooldown timer is displayed.
If you're feeling brave,\. you can also smack the dummy
to the left.\. Just be careful,\. he has a preposterous
health regeneration and can spew forth a variety of
He was the dummy I used for testing various
Ahh, so you think you're TOUGH, do ya big guy?!\.
Well why don't ya take on an endless horde of demons for a change?!
Or maybe you prefer endless hordes of loot?
I like endless hordes of demons.
I like endless hordes of demons.
Ahh a fellow student of the \C[5]Great Book\C[0]?!
An easy and straight-forward command for the \C[5]Great Book\C[0]!
Enabling the \C[5]Great Book\C[0] is as easy as flipping a switch.
Enabling the \C[5]Great Book\C[0] will restore your dimensional privileges
to the \C[5]Great Book\C[0] and all of its subcontents within that
Disabling the \C[5]Great Book\C[0] is as simple as toggling a switch.
Disabling the \C[5]Great Book\C[0] is as simple as toggling a switch.
This completely hides the \C[5]Great Book\C[0] entry from your dimensional accesses.
We can leave the \C[5]Great Book\C[0] in peace.
It looks like there were some subsystems available within your \C[5]Great Book\C[0].\.
The subsystem of the \C[1]Monsterpedia\C[0] is that much akin to the ever-famous \C[2]Bestiary\C[0].\.
The more you learn about a monster, the more you'll record into the monster's entry!
Just flipping the switch is all it took to bring it back online!
Just killing the switch is all that was needed to bring it back online!
We don't have to mess with the \C[1]Monsterpedia\C[0] this time.
